content: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. for allegedly plotting an ISIS-inspired mass shooting at a New York City Jewish community center. The attack, planned for the anniversary of the October 7th Hamas attacks, was foiled through encrypted messaging app monitoring.

title: Air India plane crash: How do Dreamliner's safety systems work? Closer look at key warning systems
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner tragically crashed near Ahmedabad, marking the model's first fatal incident and raising safety concerns. The crash revives memories of past battery issues that grounded the fleet in 2013. Despite a strong safety record and numerous warning systems, this event casts a shadow over the Dreamliner's reputation.

title: Loud noise & rush of heat: How seat 11A proved to be lucky; AI crash survivor recalls blurry memories
content: Viswashkumar Ramesh, sole survivor of the AI 171 Dreamliner crash near Ahmedabad, recalls a violent jolt and the pilot's distress call before the aircraft disintegrated. The UK-based businessman, miraculously rescued from seat 11A, now lies in hospital, haunted by the loss of his brother and the devastating tragedy.

title: Pathankot: IAF chopper makes emergency landing in Nangalpur area; second incident in a week
content: An Indian Air Force Apache helicopter landed in Nangalpur. This follows a recent emergency landing near Saharanpur due to a technical issue. In April last year, another Apache was damaged during a hard landing in Ladakh. The Apache is a advanced attack helicopter used by the IAF and Indian Army. It enhances India's combat capabilities, especially in border regions.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Thereâ€™s a new programming language. It is calledâ€¦
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Israel strikes Iran: Video shows how airspace cleared after attack; watch
content: Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites have triggered widespread air traffic chaos across the Middle East. Airlines are rerouting flights, leading to cancellations and increased fuel costs. Dubai Airport reported significant delays due to airspace closures over Iran, Iraq, and Syria. Iran's Supreme Leader has vowed retaliation, raising fears of a broader regional conflict.

title: 'America was invaded': Trump pushes for 'remigration'; slams Biden, Newsom
content: Donald Trump advocates for the "remigration" of undocumented immigrants, a term linked to far-right European movements, criticizing the Biden administration's immigration policies and California Governor Gavin Newsom. He pledged support for ICE officers and vowed to reverse what he calls an "invasion.

title: Karnataka SSLC 2 results out: Click karresult.in to check result
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) has declared the SSLC Exam 2 Result 2025 today. Held from May 26 to June 2, the supplementary exams offered a second chance to Class 10 students who failed or aimed to improve their scores. Results are available at karresults.nic.in; practical exams were conducted on June 3.

title: Honeymoon horror: Sonam says she was forced into marriage
content: Sonam, along with her accomplices, confessed to murdering her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, in a fourth attempt orchestrated between Guwahati and Sohra. Motivated by a forced marriage, Sonam and her friends plotted the murder in Indore before the wedding.

title: Air India crash: Flying has become safer over decades; last 5 yrs safest since 2000
content: A devastating Air India AI 171 flight crash in Ahmedabad, involving a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, resulted in the loss of almost all 245 on board. According to data from Aviation Safety Network, flying has actually become safer over the last few decades.

title: Operation 'Rising Lion': What nuclear facility did Israel strike in Iran? Why this site was chosen
content: Israel has launched a targeted military operation against Iran, striking nuclear and military sites, including Tehran's ballistic missile program, citing a threat to its survival. Air-raid sirens sounded in Israel as a precaution. The attack follows rising tensions over Iran's nuclear program and a recent IAEA censure, prompting international concern and a surge in oil prices.

title: 'Had it been 2pm, more wouldâ€™ve died': Inside doctors' quarters when plane crashed
content: A devastating Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad claimed the lives of resident doctors and others near BJ Medical College. The aircraft struck residential buildings and the doctors' mess, resulting in immediate fire and chaos.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices cross Rs 1 lakh mark; where are they headed?
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices in India surged past â‚¹1 lakh per 10 grams on MCX, fueled by safe-haven demand amid escalating Israel-Iran tensions and a weaker dollar. Silver also saw gains, while global gold prices exceeded $3,400 per troy ounce. Analysts suggest a 'buy on dips' strategy, anticipating further price increases in the coming months, contingent on geopolitical stability and market dynamics.

title: Israel-Iran conflict escalates: Several Air India flights diverted - full list
content: Air India changed several international flights because of the emergency in Iran. Flights to and from the US, the UK, and Canada were affected. Some flights were rerouted, and others returned to where they started. The airline is helping passengers with accommodations and refunds. Passengers should check their flight status for updates.

title: Novak Djokovic 'felt like unwanted child' compared to Federer, Nadal; admits to changing demeanour to win fans over
content: Novak Djokovic reflects on his career. He speaks about his place among tennis greats Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal. Djokovic admits feeling like an outsider. He acknowledges the impact of cultural factors on fan support. He respects his rivals. He highlights the influence of their rivalries on his development. He shares his thoughts after his French Open exit.

title: Axiom-4 mission: Nasa postpones launch to investigate leaks, says report
content: NASA has postponed the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS due to ongoing air leak investigations in the Russian segment, in collaboration with Roscosmos. Recent repairs showed initial success, but a new pressure anomaly requires further assessment. The delay impacts Axiom Space's mission, intended to transport four private astronauts via SpaceX, while prioritizing safety and structural integrity.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook after Israel strikes Iran - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: MCX Gold August 2025 contract witnessed a significant surge, opening at â‚¹100,300 due to geopolitical tensions and dollar weakness. Analysts suggest a buy-on-dips strategy near â‚¹99,000, citing strong support levels and a favorable risk-reward ratio.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Did Trump know in advance of Israel's strikes on Iran? What he said
content: Donald Trump stated he had prior knowledge of Israel's strikes on Iran, emphasizing Iran must not acquire nuclear weapons. Israel launched Operation Rising Lion, targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while the US clarified its non-involvement, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Despite the attack, Trump advocated for a diplomatic resolution to the Iran nuclear issue.

title: Bengaluru accident: 4 dead, 16 injured in APSRTC bus-truck crash near Hoskote
content: A tragic collision between an APSRTC bus and a truck near Hoskote, Bengaluru Rural, resulted in the death of four individuals, including two children, and injuries to at least 16 passengers. Preliminary investigations suggest the accident was caused by the bus driver's rash driving, suspected drowsiness, and overspeeding while attempting to overtake the truck.

title: Stock Market Crash: Nifty goes below 24,550; Sensex tanks over 1,100 - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday on global cues. While Nifty50 crashed below 24,550, BSE Sensex tumbled over 1,100 points.

title: Ex-Pakistan Test team coach Jason Gillespie shares 'unusual' move by PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi
content: Former Pakistan Test coach Jason Gillespie has criticised PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi. Naqvi did not attend a crucial team-building session. The Connection Camp aimed to improve team collaboration. Gillespie and white-ball coach Gary Kirsten attended the session. Gillespie expressed disappointment that Naqvi participated virtually. Prominent cricketers like Babar Azam also participated in the camp.

title: 'Explosions across Tehran': Visuals capture Israel's strike on Iran
content: Tensions escalate as Israel launches attacks on Iran's nuclear and military sites, including the Natanz facility, prompting international concern. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserts the strikes will persist until the threat is eliminated. The US acknowledges Israel's unilateral action, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Explosions rocked Tehran, with both nations closing their airspace amid heightened alert and emergency declarations.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: What caused the tragic accident that killed 241 passengers?
content: An Air India flight AI 171 crashed near Ahmedabad airport after takeoff. Pilots questioned why the landing gear was not retracted. They also inquired about possible engine failure. Investigation reports will analyze the causes. Experts suggest dual engine failure or bird hit as possibilities. The aircraft's trajectory and speed are under scrutiny. The final report will be made public.

title: Oakmont is going to be the main character at the 2025 U.S. Open
content: oakmont Country Club has hosted 10 U.S. Opens now -- the most of any course in the country . the clubhouse is dotted with quaint homes . it's a barrier between the idyllic neighborhood and one of golf's most terrifying tests .

title: San Francisco Unicorns register largest win in MLC history; beat defending champions Washington Freedom by 123 runs
content: Finn Allen's explosive 151, featuring a record-breaking 19 sixes, propelled the San Francisco Unicorns to a massive 123-run victory over Washington Freedom in the MLC opener. The Unicorns set a league record with 269/5, while Freedom's chase faltered after a promising start, leading to a dominant win for the home side. Allen's performance earned him Player of the Match honors.

title: Israel strikes Iran: India issues advisory for nationals
content: Following Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, the Indian Embassy in Iran has issued an advisory urging Indian nationals and persons of Indian origin to exercise caution. The embassy emphasised vigilance, avoidance of unnecessary travel, and adherence to safety protocols advised by local authorities amidst reported explosions in Tehran and Natanz.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Who was Hossein Salami? Iran's IRGC chief killed in Israeli strikes
content: Hossein Salami, the Commander-in-Chief of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), has reportedly been killed in a targeted military operation by Israel. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the operation, named "Rising Lion," aimed at dismantling Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs, citing the existential threat to Israel. Netanyahu claimed Iran possesses enough enriched uranium for nine atomic bombs.

title: Why white swan named â€˜Joyâ€™ flying to space with Shubhanshu Shukla?
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will become the first Indian astronaut to reach the ISS since 1984, aboard the Axiom-4 mission. Accompanying him is â€˜Joyâ€™, a white plush swan serving as the crewâ€™s zero-gravity indicator and a symbolic tribute to Indian culture. Representing the vahana of Goddess Saraswati, Joy blends spirituality with space tradition. The mission highlights Indiaâ€™s growing role in global space exploration, backed by ISRO and SpaceX, and underscores the soft power of cultural symbolism in scientific frontiers.

title: Boxing event shooting: Ex-NFL star Brown faces attempted murder charge
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown faces serious legal trouble. A warrant has been issued for his arrest in Miami-Dade County, accusing him of attempted murder with a firearm. The charges stem from an altercation outside a celebrity boxing event in May. Surveillance footage allegedly shows Brown firing shots at a man, who sustained injuries.

title: India vs India A intra-squad match Live streaming: When and where to watch
content: India prepares for the England Test series with a strategic intra-squad warm-up game, prioritizing privacy and acclimatization. The closed-door practice match, featuring 360 overs of simulation, aims to fine-tune player fitness, resolve selection dilemmas, and allow Shubman Gill to lead the team in a low-pressure environment.

title: Iraq closes airspace: All flights halted after Israel strikes Iran
content: Following Israeli military action against Iran, Iraq has shut down its airspace and halted all air traffic. Prime Minister Netanyahu confirmed the strikes, dubbed "Rising Lion," targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while Israel's defense minister called them preemptive due to concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment. The US has denied any involvement in the operation.

title: Operation Rising Lion: Iran's key uranium enrichment facility hit 'several times'
content: Israel has launched Operation Rising Lion, a military operation targeting Iranian military and nuclear sites, including the Natanz enrichment facility. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu stated the operation aims to neutralize Iran's nuclear program, missile capabilities, and military infrastructure. Flights have been suspended at Tehran's international airport as a precaution, marking a major escalation between the two nations.

title: Air India crash: Gujarat ex-CM Vijay Rupani believed 1206 his lucky no.
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, known for his lucky number 1206, tragically died in a plane crash on June 12, a date mirroring his cherished number. He was en route to London to visit his family, a trip rescheduled due to by-election duties.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Indian stock market on June 13, 2025, highlighting Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy, and Prince Pipes and Fittings as top stock picks. Nifty is expected to find support around 24,600-24,700, potentially reaching 25,300-25,500, while Bank Nifty aims for 57,000-57,700, supported by positive market internals.

title: 'Everybody hates Russia but loves Germany and Japan': Trump calls it a 'strange world'
content: Donald Trump spoke about World War II. He mentioned conversations with Emmanuel Macron and Vladimir Putin. Macron spoke of France's victory. Putin highlighted Soviet sacrifices. Trump expressed surprise at America's lack of commemoration. He noted the US role in the Allied victory. He also mentioned Germany and Japan's current status.

title: AI crash: Boeing, a whistleblower, & his 'gap' warning - 'Thatâ€™s not how ... '
content: Air India Flight AI171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, killing all 242 onboard. The tragedy has brought renewed attention to whistleblower Sam Salehpour's 2024 warnings about structural flaws in the 787 Dreamliner. Salehpour alleged shortcuts in manufacturing could lead to catastrophic failure. Boeing has refuted these claims, stating the aircraft is safe.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . a total of 72 students of Anna University have been enrolled in the university . the university has a record of 72 student-students .
